flawed_nl_solution:
Twice the number of students present in the science class yesterday is 70*2 = <<70*2=140>>140
Ten percent less than twice the number of students present in the class yesterday means there are 10/100*140 = <<10/100*140=1400/1>>1400/1 fewer students than twice the number present yesterday.
The number of students present in the science class today is 140-1400/1 = <<140-1400/1=-1260>>-1260
If the total number of registered students for the course who are absent today is 30, a full class of the science course has -1260+30 = -1230 students.
#### -1230

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 14, not 1400/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
